data: “Sir,” said Dr. Johnson, “we have eaten an excellent dinner, we are a company of intelligent men—although I allow that we should have difficulty in proving that we are so if it became known that we sat down with a Scotchman—and now pray do not mar the self-satisfaction which intelligent men experience after dining, by making assertions based on ignorance and maintained by sophistry.”

“Sir,” said Dr. Johnson, “we have eaten an excellent dinner, we are a company of intelligent men--although I allow that we should have difficulty in proving that we are so if it became known that we sat down with a Scotchman--and now pray do not mar the self-satisfaction which intelligent men experience after dining, by making assertions based on ignorance and maintained by sophistry.”
Moore, Frank Frankfort, 1855-1931; Gilbert, C. Allan [Illustrator]
